did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Louis C. Hughes, 1844-1915, was an Arizona pioneer, lawyer, newspaper publisher, and politician. Hughes established the Arizona Daily Star in 1877 and published it until his death. This collection contains scrapbooks of newspaper clippings relating to Hughes' political career. Also included are various telegrams congratulating Hughes on his election to governor of Arizona.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Scrapbooks of Newspaper Clippings (AZ 103). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired as gift of the Hughes family.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Arizona pioneer; lawyer, newspaper publisher, and politician. Hughes established the Arizona Daily Star in 1877 and published it until his death. He served as district attorney, probate judge, attorney general of Arizona, U.S. Court Commissioner, member and secretary to the Board of World's Fair Commissioners for Arizona, Governor of Arizona, 1893-1896, and chancellor of the Board of Regents, 1897-1898.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized chronologically in 3 volumes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Scrapbooks of newspaper clippings relating to Hughes' political career. Also includes various telegrams congratulating Hughes on his election to governor of Arizona. In three volumes.

relatedmaterial.p: AZ 104 features a collection of a letter copybook of Hughes' correspondence while serving as Governor of Arizona Territory.
